name: Nutrient paste meal
desc: A synthetic mixture of protein, carbohydrates, and vitamins, amino acids and minerals. Everything the body needs, and absolutely disgusting.

name: Simple meal
desc: A simple meal quickly cooked from a few ingredients.

name: Fine meal
desc: A complex dish assembled with care from a wide selection of ingredients.

name: Vegetarian fine meal
desc: A complex dish assembled with care from vegetarian ingredients.

name: Carnivore fine meal
desc: A complex dish assembled with care from meat ingredients.

name: Packaged survival meal
desc: A high-quality packaged meal, manufactured for use in survival situations. While it never rots, it can still deteriorate if left outside. Great for traveling.

name: Carnivore lavish meal
desc: A masterpiece of the culinary arts, this meal nourishes the body, mind, and soul.

name: Lavish meal
desc: A masterpiece of the culinary arts, this meal nourishes the body, mind, and soul.

name: Vegetarian lavish meal
desc: A masterpiece of the culinary arts, this meal nourishes the body, mind, and soul.

name: Insect meat
desc: Raw butchered flesh. If necessary, can be cooked into meals, or even eaten raw. Extremely unappetizing.

name: Hay
desc: Nutrient-rich grasses and shoots, harvested and compacted for storage. Hay is good animal feed, but inedible for humans.

name: Human meat
desc: Raw butchered flesh. Can be cooked into meals or eaten raw, although most humans dislike the idea.

name: Agave fruit
desc: Raw agave fruit.

name: Raw fungus
desc: Raw fungus obtained by harvesting fungi growing in caves. It cannot be farmed.

name: Corn
desc: Raw corn.

name: Potatoes
desc: Raw potatoes.

name: Rice
desc: A low grain plant that thrives in rich soil and yields food fast, but is not nice to eat uncooked.

name: Berries
desc: Assorted berries. Nice to eat, even when raw.

name: Milk
desc: Milk from an animal.

name: Meat
desc: Raw butchered flesh. Can be cooked into meals or eaten raw, although most humans dislike the idea.

name: Chicken egg (unfert.)
desc: Unfertilized chicken egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

name: Duck egg (unfert.)
desc: Unfertilized duck egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

name: Chicken egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized chicken egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a chick. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Duck egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized duck egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a duckling. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Insect jelly
desc: Jelly stored and used as food by oversized insects. It is smooth, rich, and brings joy to those who consume it. Because of its unique biological properties, it can nourish almost any creature and never rots.

name: Goose egg (unfert.)
desc: Unfertilized goose egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.

name: Turkey egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized turkey egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby turkey. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Goose egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized goose egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a goose. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Emu egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized emu egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby emu. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Cassowary egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized cassowary egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby cassowary. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Tortoise egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized tortoise egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby tortoise. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Ostrich egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized ostrich egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby ostrich. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Iguana egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized iguana egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby iguana. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Cobra egg (fert.)
desc: Fertilized cobra egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby cobra. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.

name: Wood
desc: Wood from trees or other fibrous plants. Useful for building structures and weapons. It is a good fuel for campfires and generators, and can be refined into chemfuel. In a pinch, a piece of wood can be used as a weapon or a leg.

melee.melee_attack_1:
log
10 dmg (Blunt)
2 seconds cooldown
15% armor penetration

name: Patchleather
desc: A weak textile created by cutting up and sewing together various types of leathers. Regardless of what kind of leather is used to create it, patchleather's irregular seams make it less tough and less insulating than any intact leather.

name: Birdskin
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped bird skin. It is quite delicate. Without its feathers, it provides little protection from heat or cold.

name: Lightleather
desc: Lightweight, thin leather. Probably harvested from a small animal. Not as protective as thicker leathers.

name: Pigskin
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped pig skin. While a decent leather, it neither protects nor insulates particularly well.

name: Dog leather
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped skin. A good traditional material for making clothes and bags.

name: Plainleather
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped skin. A good traditional material for making clothes and bags.

name: Lizardskin
desc: The tanned skin of a cold-blooded reptile. Lizardskin is reasonably tough, but does not insulate well at all.

name: Bluefur
desc: The furry pelt of muffalo. Recognizable by its distinctive blue tint. Good at temperature regulation in cold climates.

name: Camelhide
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped camel skin. Good at temperature regulation in hot climates.

name: Elephant leather
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped elephant skin. While quite tough, it is a poor insulator.

name: Panthera fur
desc: A soft furry pelt harvested from a big cat. It is difficult to pierce and insulates well against heat.

name: Wolfskin
desc: A soft furry pelt harvested from a wolf-like creature. It is difficult to pierce and insulates well against cold.

name: Heavy fur
desc: Thick leather covered in a long, rugged mat of fur. Harvested from a large, hardy animal. This thick skin insulates and protects very well.

name: Bearskin
desc: The strong furry leather of a bear. Compared to most leather, it is quite a bit tougher and a bit better at all kinds of temperature regulation

name: Foxfur
desc: The pelt of a fox. It protects well from the cold and is quite luxurious, fetching a high price.

name: Rhinoceros leather
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped rhinocerous skin. It is exceptionally durable in combat, but provides little protection from weather.

name: Human leather
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped human skin. Most people find this material horrifying. Some find it fascinating. While a decent leather, it neither protects nor insulates particularly well.

name: Guinea pig fur
desc: Sheets of guinea pig fur. It is delicate, but luxurious.

name: Chinchilla fur
desc: Tanned, dried, scraped chinchilla skin. Known as an extremely luxurious and insulating fur, it is exceptionally valuable.

name: Thrumbofur
desc: Furry pelt of a thrumbo. Luxurious and extraordinarily durable. Used for the highest-quality crafts for its insulation and strength.

name: Silver
desc: This metal is mostly used as a commodity currency. It can also be used for making decorations.

name: Steel
desc: An iron-carbon metal alloy used for building a huge variety of structures, weapons, and machines.

name: Uranium
desc: "A dark, heavy metal. While it is best known as a fuel for nuclear devices, its extreme density and hardness also make it good for making certain weapons, armor, and ammunition."

name: Plasteel
desc: Advanced spacer tech structural material. Plasteel is extremely strong due to its unique molecular structure.

name: Gold
desc: The most seductive metal of them all. While it is too soft to be of much practical use, it is strikingly beautiful and never tarnishes. Millions have died in attempting to feed the endless human thirst for gold.

name: Cloth
desc: Cloth woven from organic fibers.

name: Bison wool
desc: Thick and coarse wool of a bison. Quite warm.

name: Sheep wool
desc: Sheep's wool. It provides good insulation.

name: Muffalo wool
desc: Soft, light and provides very good insulation. Muffalo wool clothes can keep the body warm even in very cold conditions.

name: Megasloth wool
desc: While somewhat coarse, megasloth wool's long fibers make it very strong. It is very warm.

name: Alpaca wool
desc: The remarkably soft wool of an alpaca. It is warm, protects well from heat, and fetches a high price.

name: Synthread
desc: Spacer-tech synthetic fabric designed for making ordinary clothes. It is soft, light, strong, and insulates well.

name: Devilstrand
desc: Fabric spun from microfibers extracted from devilstrand mushrooms. It is very tough, good at insulating, and protects exceptionally well against flame.

name: Hyperweave
desc: Nano-fibers woven into sheets molecule-by-molecule using specialized production mechanites. While it flexes freely most of the time, it stiffens to absorb blows as they land, and is incredibly difficult to break. The secrets of its production are known only to the most advanced glitterworld cultures.

name: Slate blocks
desc: Blocks of solid slate. A dull-looking rock that chips easily.

name: Sandstone blocks
desc: Blocks of solid sandstone. Sandstone is a relatively soft rock and chips easily.

name: Limestone blocks
desc: Blocks of solid limestone.

name: Marble blocks
desc: Blocks of solid marble. Marble is a soft, beautiful stone, known for being easy to sculpt.

name: Granite blocks
desc: Blocks of solid granite. Granite is a very hard stone.

name: Jade
desc: A hard, green stone. Because of its beauty and rarity, jade is often used for ornaments and decorations. Its hardness and density also makes it a good material for blunt weapons.
